attributes.description: Is one of the testing Grounds used by Dodge and Chrysler for testing their vehicles and improving them

attributes.address: 5800 Ann Arbor Rd, Dundee, MI 48131, USA
attributes.title: Global Engine Manufacturing Alliance (GEMA)

attributes.description: Launched in 1996, the Automotive Research and Development Centre (ARDC) is an initiative for automotive research and testing jointly directed by the University of Windsor and Chrysler Canada. It was the first partnership of its kind in Canada, providing unique automotive research and development opportunities, benefitting students, faculty and company engineers who work together on a wide variety of projects.
attributes.title: Automotive Research and Development Centre

attributes.description:
Facility was built in 1928. In 1939, a special Chrysler royal convertible sedan was built for the 1939 Royal Tour and thousands were shipped overseas.

The vehicles assembled here are sent to dealerships for sale
attributes.address: 2199 Chrysler Center, Windsor, ON N8W 3Y6, Canada
attributes.title: Windsor Assembly Plant

attributes.description:
Facility was built in 1986 and acquired by Chrysler Corporation with purchase of American Motors Corporation (AMC) in August 1987.

From the Casting plant parts are sent to the assembly plant where vehicles are put together on the assembly line.

The vehicles assembled here are sent to dealerships for sale
attributes.address: 2000 Williams Pkwy, Brampton, ON L6S 5R7, Canada
attributes.title: Brampton Assembly Plant

attributes.description: Facility was built in 1942 and purchased by Chrysler Corporation in 1964. Major expansions were implemented in 1965 and 1998. In August 2010, Chrysler Group announced it would invest $27.2 million to produce front and rear crossmembers for future Chrysler vehicles.
attributes.address: 15 Brown's Line, Toronto, ON M8W 1N6, Canada
attributes.title: Chrysler Manufacturing

attributes.description: This is the dodge headquarters located in Windsor Ontario. It was founded as the Chrysler Corporation in 1925, Chrysler Canada Inc
